meanings.definition: Control every part, however small, of (an enterprise or activity)
meanings.sent1: She micromanaged the project, checking every detail multiple times.
meanings.sent2: The boss constantly micromanaged his employees, making sure they followed his instructions to the letter.
meanings.sent3: The teacher micromanaged the class so much that even the pencils had to be perfectly aligned on the desks.
meanings.sent4: Her need to micromanage everything turned her life into a never-ending checklist.
meanings.sent5: The chef micromanaged the recipe, measuring each ingredient with precision to create the perfect dish.

meanings.definition: Manage with excessive control or attention to minor details.
meanings.sent1: He felt frustrated when his supervisor micromanaged his every move at work.
meanings.sent2: The team felt demotivated because their manager constantly micromanaged their tasks.
meanings.sent3: The robot micromanaged the assembly line, ensuring each piece was in its exact place.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a micromanaged clock, ticking with precision and control over every thought.
meanings.sent5: The artist micromanaged the painting, focusing on every brushstroke to capture the perfect image.
